name: Intro to Writing Creative Nonfiction
long_desc: This course will expose you to several contemporary Creative Non Fiction writers, while helping you connect with your own life stories so that they can be shaped into narratives. Youll be reading and analyzing both short and long form non fiction, so as to learn the elements of the art and craft of this genre. A high priority will be given to creating a community spirit in our class, so as to inspire you and your writing through connections not just to professional writers, but to the writers who will be your classmates.

custom_fields.goals: Same answer for the previous question applies.
custom_fields.key_topics: Nonfiction, memoir, personal essays, cultural commentary
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: An enthusiasm for reading and writing nonfiction. As an introductory course, I expect enthusiasm more so than any kind of expert grasp.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Students come to class with written responses to published work, and write their own stories, one of which will be revised at the end of the semester.
custom_fields.relevance: My students will cultivate and sharped their ability to articulate personal truths, to do the sort of self-sorting that allows them to makes sense of both society and their place within it, to construct powerful and informed narratives, and to translate big ideas into accessible prose.
